column9: Snow cover—or the area of land that is covered by accumulated snow at any given time—helps regulate Earth's surface temperature when it is present, and it helps fill rivers and reservoirs once it melts away. from https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/news/picture-climate-what%E2%80%99s-snow-cover-got-do-it
column11: . The total amount of snow that accumulates on the ground in a given location, including that from snowfall, snowdrift, and avalanche.
